meanings.definition: The act of taking care of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her caretakings of the stray kittens showed her kind heart.
meanings.sent2: The caretakings of the garden involved watering and weeding.
meanings.sent3: The caretakings of the mischievous puppy included cleaning up torn paper.
meanings.sent4: His caretakings of the fragile antique vase were meticulous and gentle.
meanings.sent5: The caretakings of the injured bird were done with utmost tenderness.

meanings.definition: The responsibilities or duties associated with caring for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The caretakings of the elderly require patience and compassion.
meanings.sent2: His caretakings of the household included cooking and cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The caretakings of the mischievous toddler involved constant supervision.
meanings.sent4: Her caretakings of the family finances were meticulous and organized.
meanings.sent5: The caretakings of the fragile ecosystem are crucial for its survival.
